intro: Cistanthera thouarsii, commonly known as the Madagascar cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the island's unique climate. Its leaves are usually narrow and evergreen, and it produces small, yellowish or white flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its restricted range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
